clinical_study.brief_title: High Volume Specialty Knee Replacement Surgeons Achieve Better Clinical and Quality-of-Life Scores
clinical_study.official_title: High Volume Specialty Knee Replacement Surgeons Achieve Better Clinical and Quality-of-Life Scores

brief_summary.textblock: To determine whether specialty training or high volume of operative experience is associated with better clinical outcome and quality-of-life scores.

detailed_description.textblock: Primary total knee replacements are becoming a commonly performed procedure. Many general orthopaedists can perform large numbers of such surgeries. Thus, we aim to find out if there is value of having surgeons with AR fellowship training to perform primary total knee arthroplasty. This has an implication in the direction of the training of future AR surgeons and in the distribution of operative cases.

primary_outcome.measure: To determine whether specialty training or high volume of operative experience is associated with better clinical outcome and quality-of-life scores.

secondary_outcome.measure: To determine which other factors are predictors of better outcome score and quality-of-life scores.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Patients operated by AR trained surgeons
arm_group.description: patients who had their total knee replacements performed by surgeons who have completed a fellowship training in adult reconstruction surgery
patients who had their total knee replacements performed by orthopaedic surgeons who did not complete an adult reconstruction fellowship training

intervention.arm_group_label: Patients operated by AR trained surgeons

study_pop.textblock: patients seen at Singapore General Hospital who require total knee arthroplasty

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients who require total knee arthroplasty seen during the specified period
Exclusion Criteria:
- revision total knee arthroplasty
- unicompartmental or bicompartmental knee arthroplasty
